page.title: 20WILDLIFE IN ASHWELLTHORPE
page.content: There are 110 acres of ancient decid- uous coppiced woodland untouched by farm technology, with a rich boulder clay flora including unbroken acres of spellbinding wild garlic. Grey squir- rels have replaced red. Nightingales & hornets nest there. Common toads (800 in 1984) leave the wood every spring & cross The Street to spawn in the pit at Wood Farm resulting in a gruesome accident blackspot. {Chemicals}producing clean crops in the fields leave few poppies, corn mari- golds, pimpernel or heartsease.{Hedge- {rows are eradicated or flail-cut & {roadside verges mown so low that scabious, mallows & vetches are often unable to flower there.{Maintenance {work excavating ditches is so severe that these wildlife reserves are shorn of meadowsweet & great hairy willow herb.
